channel.title: OAuth and OIDC :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: OAuth and OIDC Explained Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Links to original docs: - OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/oauth-openid/ Structure type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic. Such high-level overviews provide developers with a broad understanding of the system’s workings. Deeper discussions into single topics are called Explanations.

item.title: Flows (grant types)
item.description: Flows (grant types) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Structure type: Navigation Content type: Autogenerated Index An autogenerated index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs.

item.title: Authorization servers
item.description: Authorization servers Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Links to original docs: - Authorization servers: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/auth-servers/ Structure type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic. Such high-level overviews provide developers with a broad understanding of the system’s workings. Deeper discussions into single topics are called Explanations.

item.title: Access, ID, and refresh tokens
item.description: Access, ID, and refresh tokens Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Overview of Access, Id and refresh tokens. Links to original docs: Some content for the new doc originating from: Refresh access tokens: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/refresh-tokens/main/ Possible Access and ID token content is in other docs as well Why is this here?: - Group results showed authorization server is a “no consensus” term, which may indicate term confusion and/or differing interpretations by respondents.

item.title: JSON Web Tokens (JWTs)
item.description: JSON web tokens Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Overview of JSON web tokens. Why is this here?: - External Oktane 2023 - MatchIt: 21% of respondents got JWTs incorrect in the MatchIt exercise. External Oktane 2023 - GroupIt: 9.3% were unable to categorize JSON web token Respondents placed JSON web tokens under the broad APIS and SDKs group at 48.

item.title: Tenants and Multi-tenant Apps
item.description: Tenants and Multi-tenant applications Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Defines what a tenant is , what multi-tenancy is, why it can be good to divide users up into tenants internally, how an app is considered to be multi-tenant, and at a very high-level how an app knows which tenant to use when a user wants to sign in.

item.title: Identity Providers
item.description: Identity Providers Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Changes to be made: This is a new doc defining what an identity provider is, how Okta acts as on, what an external identity provider is, and how an app and Okta interact with them (in overview - not very much detail - this is covered in Build > Federate Identities).
